sentence.Network_en: The French constructed a series of fortresses from Dunkirk on the Channel coast to Douai.
sentence.Network_cn: 法国人在从敦克尔刻到杜埃的英吉利海峡沿岸修筑了一系列要塞。

sentence.Network_en: She'll go sailing proudly down the years in the epic of Dunkirk.
sentence.Network_cn: 在敦刻尔克之役可歌可泣的历史中,它将年复一年地傲然前进.

sentence.Network_en: Here at Dunkirk is another English epic.
sentence.Network_cn: 在敦刻尔克这个地方,又一次发生英国人可歌可泣的事迹.

means.word_mean: 1. a crisis in which a desperate effort is the only alternative to defeat;

sentences.sentence: "the Russians had to pull off a Dunkirk to get out of there"

means.word_mean: 2. a city in northern France on the North Sea where in World War II (1940) 330,000 Allied troops had to be evacuated from the beaches at Dunkirk in a desperate retreat under enemy fire
